instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message:
hello i'm new, I have a board does not turn on, the usb c ammeter 5.1v 0A in all usb c ports,
PPBUS_G3H=0
PPDIN_G3H=5.1V
PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X=0

I do not know what measures to take more in these new computers t2 chip

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H is the first power rail to come on; even with only 5V at USB-C port.
Check diode mode to ground.

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message: yes, short PPBUS_G3H. what voltage should it be PPBUS_G3H only 5v USB-C port.

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message:
Post the exact ohm resistance to ground at PPBUS_G3H and all big coils near CPU.
Use ohm scale, not diode mode.

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H=4 OHMS
L7410=6.6 OHMS
L7420=6.6 OHMS
L7211=3.1 OHMS
L7221=3.1 OHMS
L7231=3.1 OHMS
L7330=20.6 OHMS
LA340=2.2 OHMS
LA640=2.2 OHMS
LA650=2.2 OHMS
LA350=25.5 OHMS
LA300=341 OHMS

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message: Check exact resistance between PPBUS_G3H and L7211.

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message: Check the same between PPBUS_G3H and LA340.

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message:
Looks safe to inject voltage into PPBUS_G3H.
First be VERY sure no short between PPBUS_G3H and any secondary coil!

Start with 1V and increase slowly, untill detect something hot; possibly a filter cap.
Set the amp limit of lab PSU to max.

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message:
Remove it and test the board.
Replace it, if available.

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message: ok, remove it, board turns on.I don't have a replacement capacitor.There is no problem if I leave the board without the capacitor?

threads.title: 820-01041 not turning on
threads.message:
It should work.
Make stock of scrap boards, if you plan to stay in business with Apple stuff.
